AccessState.description: Describes the options for the access characteristics of an endpoint.

enumDescriptions.NonOptimized: The endpoints are in an active and non-optimized state.
enumDescriptions.Optimized: The endpoints are in an active and optimized state.
enumDescriptions.Standby: The endpoints are in a standby state.
enumDescriptions.Transitioning: The endpoints are transitioning to a new state.
enumDescriptions.Unavailable: The endpoints are in an unavailable state.

enumLongDescriptions.NonOptimized: This value shall indicate each endpoint is in an active and non-optimized state.
enumLongDescriptions.Optimized: This value shall indicate each endpoint is in an active and optimized state.
enumLongDescriptions.Standby: This value shall indicate each endpoint is in a standby state.
enumLongDescriptions.Transitioning: This value shall indicate each endpoint is transitioning to a new state.
enumLongDescriptions.Unavailable: This value shall indicate each endpoint is in an unavailable state.

AccessState.longDescription: This type shall describe the access to all associated resources through all aggregated endpoints.

EndpointGroup.description: The EndpointGroup schema describes group of endpoints that are managed as a unit.
EndpointGroup.longDescription: This resource shall represent a group of endpoints that are managed as a unit for a Redfish implementation.

title: #EndpointGroup.EndpointGroup
